```{r, include=FALSE}
library(RPostgreSQL)
source("W:\\RDA Team\\R\\credentials_source.R")
source("chart_functions.R")

pillars_conn <- connect_to_db("rjs_pillars")

meta<-dbGetQuery(pillars_conn, "SELECT * FROM metadata_race_labels")%>%
  mutate(race_label_short=ifelse(race_base %in% "nh_twoormor", "Two or more", race_label_short))

df <- dbGetQuery(pillars_conn, "SELECT * FROM report_timespent_div_ficard_race_person") 

# Option 1: Visualize duration rate/population as grouped bar graph just for all divisions only Latinx/NH Black ------------

# filter out Latinx/Black

df1<-df%>%
  filter(race=='latinx' | race == 'nh_black')

# Pivot table to longer for graphing

df1<-df1%>%
  select(div_name, div, race, stop_result_simple, duration_rate, pop_rate)%>%
  mutate(pop_rate=pop_rate*100)%>%
  filter(stop_result_simple=="Field interview card completed")%>%
    pivot_longer(5:6, names_to = "measure", values_to = "value")%>%
  filter(!is.na(value)) # no pop estimates for nh_sswana & nh_multi_race

```

```{r}

#Option 1 Graph: Nh_Black only

graph_b<-df1 %>% 
  filter(race=='nh_black')%>%
  hchart('column', hcaes(x = div_name, y = value, group = measure)) %>%
  hc_colors(c("#211447", peridot))

graph_b

```

```{r}
##   FINAL CHOICE: I think the graph from Option 1 -NH Black only --is the most compelling. We can see across all divisions that people perceived as Nh_Black are stopped for FI cards at higher percentages relative to their population


# add methodnote
methodnote <- "Analysis for all officer-initiated stops resulting in a field interview card only. Officers spent a total of 118,970.3 hours on officer-initiated stops that resulted in a field interview card only in 2022."

# create caption
caption_text <- paste("<br><br>", sourcenote, methodnote)

# add title and subtitle
top_finding<-"SDPD disproportionately stops people perceived as Black for stops with Field Interview Cards"
subtitle<-"Percent of stops resulting in a field interview card by race"

# tooltip

tooltip_text<- paste0("Out of 100 hours spent on <b>officer-initiated stops resulting in a field interview card</b> in <b>{point.div}</b>, SDPD spent <b>{point.duration_rate:.1f}</b> hours conducting field interviews on people perceived as <b>{point.race_label_short}</b>. <b>{point.race_label_short}</b>. make up <b>{point.race_label_short}</b>.")

# Final Graph

df1<-df1%>%
        mutate(measure=ifelse(measure %in% 'pop_rate','Percent of total population','Percent time spent'))

df1$measure <- factor(df1$measure, levels = c("Percent time spent", "Percent of total population"))


df1 %>% 
  arrange(div, -value)%>%
  filter(race=='nh_black')%>%
  hchart('bar', hcaes(x = div_name, y = value, group = measure),
         tooltip =  list(headerFormat='',pointFormat=tooltip_text)) %>%
  hc_colors(c("#211447", peridot))%>%
   hc_title(
      text = top_finding) %>%
    
    hc_subtitle(
      text = subtitle) %>%
    
    hc_caption(
      text = caption_text) %>%
  
   hc_xAxis(title = list(text = ""),
                          labels=list(position="bottom",
                                      style=list(fontSize="12px")),
    categories = list(
      "SOUTHEASTERN",
      "MID-CITY",
      "CENTRAL",
      "EASTERN",
      "NORTHEASTERN",
      "WESTERN",
      "NORTHWESTERN",
      "NORTHERN",
      "SOUTHERN"
    ))%>%
   hc_yAxis(title = list(text = paste0(""),
                          labels = list(style=list(fontSize="12px"))))%>%
      hc_add_theme(cc_theme)%>%
    hc_chart(
      marginRight=120) %>%
  
  hc_legend(enabled = TRUE, 
              # reversed =  TRUE,
              x=20)%>% 
    
    hc_exporting(
      enabled = TRUE, sourceWidth=900, sourceHeight=600, 
      chartOptions=list(plotOptions=list(series=list(dataLabels=list(enabled=TRUE,format='{point.rate:.1f}%')))),
      filename = paste0(subtitle,"_Catalyst California, catalystcalifornia.org, 2023."),
      buttons=list(contextButton=list(menuItems=list('downloadPNG', 'downloadSVG',
                                                     'downloadXLS', 'downloadCSV'))))




dbDisconnect(pillars_conn)
```
